intro.title: Description
intro.text:
The Elasticsearch Mesos framework allows to deploy Elasticsearch on a large Mesos cluster which runs on any kind of hardware.

The framework helps to automate installation, running and scaling of the system. The user interface shows the the cluster state and performance overview.

slides.caption: STEP 1.Mesos cluster with Marathon and Chronos frameworks already running.
STEP 2a.ES framework scheduler is deployed to the master node with a configured number (3) of slaves to be launched.
STEP 3.Once ES scheduler accepts the offers, it deploys executors together with ES nodes in containers to Mesos slaves.
STEP 4.ES nodes discovery. Zookeeper plugins in ES nodes registers with Zookeeper. This allows the nodes to find each other.
STEP 5.The ES nodes found each other and form a cluster.

items.title: Cloud
items.content: Runs on ​_any_​ hardware, cloud or on-premises (* minimum RAM requirements for ES process).

items.title: Scaling
items.content: The framework can be scaled up and down horizontally.

items.title: Runtime
items.content: Run the framework as Java processes or Docker containers.

items.title: User Interface
items.content: Web user interface on scheduler port 31100.

items.title: api
items.content: Access information of the UI via the API.

items.title: Written in java
items.content: The framework is implemented written in Java 8.

items.title: Configurable
items.content: Cluster settings such as dimensions, cluster name and Elasticsearch settings are configurable.

items.title: Tested
items.content: The major features of the framework are tested by minimesos system tests.

items.title: Free
items.content: The framework is open source and free to use.
